content.question: The position of a particle moving in the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane is given by the vector-valued function <math alttext="p"><mi>p</mi></math> defined by <math alttext="p open parentheses t close parentheses equals open angle brackets x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close angle brackets"><mi>p</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced close=">" open="<"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math> for <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 10"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></math> seconds. Which of the following is true about the distance between the particle’s position and the origin at time <math alttext="t equals 4"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math> seconds?

choices.label: The distance is <math alttext="square root of open parentheses x open parentheses 4 close parentheses close parentheses squared plus open parentheses y open parentheses 4 close parentheses close parentheses squared end root"><msqrt><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mn>4</mn></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>4</mn></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup></msqrt></math> because this value is the magnitude of the position vector at time <math alttext="t equals 4"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math> seconds.

The distance is <math alttext="4 open parentheses fraction numerator y open parentheses 4 close parentheses minus y open parentheses 0 close parentheses over denominator 4 minus 0 end fraction close parentheses"><mn>4</mn><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>4</mn></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>0</mn></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mfrac></mfenced></math> because this value is the product of the length of the interval and the average rate of change of <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> over the interval <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 4"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn></math>.

The distance is <math alttext="fraction numerator y open parentheses 4 close parentheses minus y open parentheses 0 close parentheses over denominator x open parentheses 4 close parentheses minus x open parentheses 0 close parentheses end fraction"><mfrac><mrow><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>4</mn></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>0</mn></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mn>4</mn></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mn>0</mn></mfenced></mrow></mfrac></math> because this value is the average rate of change over the interval <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 4"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn></math>.

The distance is <math alttext="open parentheses x open parentheses 4 close parentheses minus x open parentheses 0 close parentheses close parentheses plus open parentheses y open parentheses 4 close parentheses minus y open parentheses 0 close parentheses close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mn>4</mn></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mn>0</mn></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>4</mn></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>0</mn></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math> because this value is the sum of the change in the horizontal position and the change in the vertical position, over the interval <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 4"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn></math>.

content.answer: The distance is <math alttext="square root of open parentheses x open parentheses 4 close parentheses close parentheses squared plus open parentheses y open parentheses 4 close parentheses close parentheses squared end root"><msqrt><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mn>4</mn></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>4</mn></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup></msqrt></math> because this value is the magnitude of the position vector at time <math alttext="t equals 4"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math> seconds.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Support conclusions or choices with a logical rationale or appropriate data.
